item.title: Congestion & queuing traffic & ‘bottle necks’, 17th September
item.description:
The so-called Chinese roundabout ‘Improvements Scheme’ is now the cause of increased queuing traffic, increased pollution & delays to the emergency services, vehicles, HGVs, buses, etc attempting to enter the Chinese roundabout, due to the reduced entries (from 2 lanes to a single lane) onto the roundabout. The position/placement of the pedestrian crossings right ‘front’ of the roundabout are also ill-thought out. Also myself, my neighbours, residents, friends, etc have never yet observed ANY cyclists dismounting & actually walking across the dedicated cyclists crossings! The shared pedestrian/cyclist pavements are an ‘accident waiting to happen”. Personally, recently I was very close to being hit by a cyclist travelling at speed who rounded the corner from Wickham Rd onto Hayes Lane using the pedestrian area (fortunately I was able to quickly jump to the side to avoid impact). The cyclist said nothing and continued on his way. And finally, I (and others) have observed emergency ambulances stuck in queuing traffic in Hayes Lane, who are then forced to cross to the opposite side of the road to enter the roundabout AGAINST oncoming traffic. This unfortunately is an ACCIDENT WAITING TO HAPPEN! Such a shocking use of £1.285 million!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Wickham Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo, 17th September
item.description:
Kafayat Musa 23 Bradenham close London SE17 2GF 17/09/2025 To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to raise a complaint regarding an ongoing hygiene and safety issue outside my home. There is dog foul directly in front of my main entrance, and I do not own a dog. It has been there for over 24 hours and is becoming smudged, creating an unsanitary and unpleasant situation. This is particularly concerning as I have young children, and I am worried about the risk of accidentally bringing this into my home. Unfortunately, I cannot avoid using the front entrance as my back door only locks from the inside, leaving me with no alternative. I kindly request that urgent action is taken to have this cleaned and that steps are put in place to prevent similar occurrences in future. This is not only a matter of cleanliness but also of public health and safety. I would appreciate your prompt response and swift resolution to this matter. Yours faithfully, Kafayat Musa

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 390, Albany Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
